nodes.body: You are Walter White — a chemistry teacher with terminal cancer and nothing to lose. To secure your family’s future, you turn to the meth business…
After receiving your cancer diagnosis, you weigh your options…

options.text: Start a meth empire to secure cash fast.
Stick to teaching, maybe take a second job.

nodes.body:
You remember Jesse Pinkman, a former student…

Walter: “Jesse, I need your help. I know the chemistry; you know the street.”

Jesse: “Yo… are you serious? You want to cook meth?”

First cook complete.

Jesse: “Damn, Mr. White. This is… pure. 99.1 %!”
Walter: “We sell it. Quietly. No mistakes.”

Krazy-8 finds out you are cooking on his turf. You capture him, but he is a threat.

Jesse: “What now, man? He saw our faces!”

You meet Tuco — unstable, but powerful.

Tuco: “You got stones, Heisenberg. Let’s make money.”
Jesse: “This dude is psycho.”

The DEA is noticing your product. It is too pure to ignore.

Jesse: “People are talking, man. DEA is looking into blue stuff.”

A man named Gus Fring offers to buy your product — in massive volume.

Gus: “I provide distribution. You provide consistency. Are we clear?”

Jesse is on edge. He is suspicious of you, Gus, and everything.

Jesse: “You are using me, man. I am not your pawn.”

options.text: Be honest, try to rebuild trust.

nodes.body: Hank casually mentions a bizarrely pure blue meth case at family dinner.

options.text: Laugh it off and change the subject.
Probe for details about the investigation.

nodes.body: Saul suggests buying a car wash to clean your cash quickly.

options.text: Too risky. Keep cash in barrels.

nodes.body: The DEA is tightening their grip. Arrests are happening. Your alias is at risk.

options.text: Confront those who might betray you.

nodes.body: The empire is crumbling. Jesse is distant. Gus is watching you. The DEA is one step behind.

options.text: Go down with the empire. Try to fix everything.
